page.title: 10A visit to the doctor.
page.content: One evening I had an appointment to see my doctor at the Health Centre, because the bones behind my ears were swollen. My father took me in the car, and when we got inside the receptionist told us to wait in the waiting room. Eventually, she took us down a corridor to wait outside the doctors room. When the light above the door turned from red to green we went inside. The doctor looked at my ears and pressed the bone. He said I had swollen glands. He wrote a prescription for some cream, and we collected it at the pharmacy on the way out. The woman behind the counter gave me a vitamin lolly and told me to put the cream on my ears twice a day. After two weeks my swollen glands went down to normal size.
